Breakfast.title: Overnight Oats with Chia, Flax and Berries
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk or low fat milk
steps: Combine oats, milk, chia, flax and cinnamon in a jar.
Stir, top with berries, cover and refrigerate overnight.
Sweeten to taste and serve.
Breakfast.prepNotes: Mix and refrigerate 6 to 12 hours before breakfast.

Breakfast.title: Avocado Tomato Whole Grain Toast
ingredients: Lemon juice, black pepper, chili flakes
steps: Toast the bread.
Mash avocado with lemon, pepper and chili flakes.
Spread on toast, top with tomatoes and drizzle olive oil.
Sprinkle seeds if using.

Breakfast.title: Greek Yogurt Parfait with Walnuts and Oats
ingredients: 3/4 cup low fat plain Greek yogurt
steps: Layer yogurt, oats and fruit in a bowl or glass.
Top with walnuts and a light drizzle of honey.
Breakfast.prepNotes: Lightly toast walnuts 3 to 5 minutes for extra flavor (optional).

Breakfast.title: Barley Porridge with Apple and Cinnamon
ingredients: 1/2 cup pearled barley or barley flakes
steps: Rinse barley. Add to pot with water or milk and bring to a boil.
Simmer until tender (barley flakes 8 to 10 min, pearled 25 to 30 min).
Stir in apple, cinnamon and raisins. Top with nuts and serve.
Breakfast.prepNotes: Soak pearled barley 1 hour to reduce cook time (optional).

Breakfast.title: Spinach Flax Smoothie
steps: Add all ingredients to a blender.
Blend until smooth and serve immediately.
Breakfast.prepNotes: Soak oats 10 minutes in milk for extra smooth texture (optional).

Lunch.title: Mediterranean Chickpea Quinoa Salad
ingredients: 1 cup cooked chickpeas (low sodium) or 1/2 cup dry soaked overnight
1/2 tsp cumin, salt and pepper to taste
steps: Combine chickpeas, quinoa, cucumber, tomato, onion and parsley.
Whisk olive oil, lemon, cumin, salt and pepper.
Toss and chill 15 minutes before serving.
Lunch.prepNotes: Soak dry chickpeas 8 to 12 hours and cook until tender, or rinse canned chickpeas.

Lunch.title: Red Lentil Vegetable Soup
steps: Rinse lentils well.
Saute onion, carrot, celery and garlic in olive oil 3 to 4 minutes.
Add spices, tomatoes, broth and lentils. Simmer 15 to 20 minutes until lentils are soft.
Finish with lemon juice and serve.
Lunch.prepNotes: Rinse lentils until water runs clear to reduce foam.

Lunch.title: Grilled Salmon with Farro and Greens
steps: Cook farro in salted water until tender; drain.
Season salmon with lemon, pepper and a pinch of salt.
Grill or pan sear salmon 3 to 4 minutes per side.
Wilt greens with olive oil. Serve salmon with farro and greens.
Lunch.prepNotes: Thaw salmon in the refrigerator overnight if frozen.

Lunch.title: Black Bean Brown Rice Bowl
ingredients: 1 cup cooked black beans (low sodium) or 1/2 cup dry soaked overnight
Lime juice, cumin, chili powder, cilantro
steps: Warm beans with cumin and chili powder.
Assemble bowl with rice, beans, corn, pepper, tomato and avocado.
Drizzle olive oil and lime, top with cilantro.
Lunch.prepNotes: Soak dry beans 8 to 12 hours and cook until tender, or rinse canned beans.

Lunch.title: Hummus Veggie Whole Wheat Wrap
steps: Spread hummus on tortillas.
Layer cucumber, tomato, carrot and lettuce.
Drizzle a little olive oil if desired and roll up.

Dinner.title: Baked Mackerel with Roasted Vegetables and Barley
steps: Toss vegetables with half the olive oil, roast at 425 F (220 C) for 15 to 20 minutes.
Season mackerel with lemon, pepper and herbs, bake 8 to 10 minutes until flaky.
Serve with cooked barley.
Dinner.prepNotes: Thaw fish if frozen. Soak barley 1 hour to reduce cook time (optional).

Dinner.title: Tofu Broccoli Stir Fry with Brown Rice
steps: Press tofu and cut into cubes.
Stir fry tofu until lightly browned; set aside.
Stir fry broccoli, pepper, garlic and ginger 3 to 4 minutes.
Return tofu, add soy sauce, toss and serve over brown rice.
Dinner.prepNotes: Press tofu 15 to 20 minutes to remove moisture. Start rice ahead.

Dinner.title: Whole Wheat Pasta Primavera
steps: Cook pasta until al dente.
Saute garlic and vegetables in olive oil 4 to 5 minutes.
Toss with pasta, basil, pepper and a pinch of salt.

Dinner.title: Chickpea and Spinach Stew
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups cooked chickpeas (or 3/4 cup dry soaked overnight)
steps: Saute onion and garlic in olive oil.
Add tomatoes, spices and chickpeas; simmer 12 to 15 minutes.
Stir in spinach to wilt and serve.

Dinner.title: Baked Cod with Warm Lentil Salad
steps: Simmer lentils with carrot, celery and onion until tender; drain and toss with olive oil and lemon.
Season cod with pepper and lemon; bake at 400 F (205 C) for 10 to 12 minutes.
Serve fish over warm lentils with parsley.
Dinner.prepNotes: Rinse lentils. Soak 30 minutes to reduce cook time (optional). Thaw fish if frozen.

Breakfast.title: Moong Dal Chilla with Veg Filling
steps: Soak moong dal and grind into a smooth batter with cumin and salt.
Spread a ladle on a hot nonstick pan.
Top with onion, tomato and chili, drizzle a few drops of oil, cook both sides until golden.
Breakfast.prepNotes: Soak moong dal 2 to 4 hours (or overnight) before grinding.

Breakfast.title: Vegetable Dalia (Broken Wheat Upma)
ingredients: 1 tsp mustard seeds, 6 to 8 curry leaves
steps: Dry roast dalia 3 to 4 minutes.
Heat oil, splutter mustard and curry leaves, saute onion and vegetables.
Add dalia and 2 cups water, salt; cook covered until fluffy.
Finish with lemon.
Breakfast.prepNotes: Rinse dalia. Soak 10 minutes to reduce cook time (optional).

Breakfast.title: Oats Vegetable Cheela
ingredients: 1/4 cup low fat curd or water to make batter
1/2 cup mixed grated vegetables (carrot, zucchini, capsicum)
steps: Mix oats powder, curd or water and spices to a pourable batter.
Stir in grated vegetables.
Cook thin cheelas on a hot pan with a few drops of oil.
Breakfast.prepNotes: Rest batter 10 minutes for better binding.

Breakfast.title: Sprouted Moong Salad
ingredients: Lemon juice, chaat masala (low sodium), pepper
steps: Lightly steam sprouts 2 to 3 minutes (optional).
Combine all ingredients and toss with lemon and spices.
Breakfast.prepNotes: Sprout moong 24 to 36 hours: soak 8 hours, drain and keep moist until sprouted.

Breakfast.title: Poha with Peas and Peanuts (Low Oil)
steps: Rinse poha and rest 10 minutes.
Heat oil, splutter mustard, add peanuts, chili, curry leaves and onion; saute.
Add peas, turmeric, poha and salt; toss gently and finish with lemon.

Lunch.title: Chana Masala (Low Oil)
steps: Pressure cook soaked chickpeas until tender.
Saute onion in oil, add ginger garlic, spices and tomato puree; cook until thick.
Add chickpeas and simmer 10 minutes; garnish with coriander.
Lunch.prepNotes: Soak chickpeas 8 to 12 hours; pressure cook until soft.

Lunch.title: Masoor Dal Tadka with Spinach
steps: Rinse dal, add water, turmeric, onion and tomato; simmer until dal is soft.
Add spinach to wilt.
Heat oil, splutter cumin and pour over dal; finish with lemon.

Lunch.title: Rajma Masala (Low Oil)
steps: Pressure cook soaked rajma until tender.
Saute onion in oil; add ginger garlic, spices and tomato puree; cook to a thick masala.
Add rajma and simmer 12 to 15 minutes; garnish.
Lunch.prepNotes: Soak rajma 8 to 12 hours; pressure cook until soft.

Lunch.title: Grilled Tandoori Fish with Brown Rice and Kachumber
ingredients: 2 firm fish fillets (surmai, cod or salmon)
1 tsp lemon juice, salt to taste
steps: Mix curd, spices, lemon and salt; coat fish and marinate.
Grill or bake fish until cooked through.
Serve with brown rice and kachumber salad.
Lunch.prepNotes: Marinate fish 30 to 60 minutes. Thaw fish if frozen.

Lunch.title: Mixed Vegetable Tofu Stir Fry with Chapati
steps: Press tofu and cut into cubes.
Stir fry onion, cauliflower and peppers with ginger garlic and spices.
Add tofu and toss gently. Serve with chapatis.
Lunch.prepNotes: Press tofu 15 to 20 minutes. Prepare chapati dough ahead if needed.

Dinner.title: Lauki Chana Dal (Bottle Gourd with Bengal Gram)
steps: Soak chana dal and pressure cook until half done.
Saute cumin and onion in oil, add tomato and turmeric; cook briefly.
Add lauki and dal; pressure cook until both are tender. Garnish.
Dinner.prepNotes: Soak chana dal 30 to 60 minutes for even cooking.

Dinner.title: Baingan Bharta (Low Oil)
ingredients: 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, chili to taste
steps: Roast eggplants on flame or in oven until charred and soft; cool and peel.
Saute cumin, onion and ginger garlic in minimal oil; add tomatoes and cook down.
Mash in eggplant, cook 5 minutes and garnish.
Dinner.prepNotes: Roast eggplants 30 to 40 minutes and cool before peeling.

Dinner.title: Methi Moong Dal
steps: Soak moong dal 30 minutes, then simmer with turmeric until almost tender.
Saute cumin, onion and tomato in oil; add methi and wilt.
Combine with dal and simmer briefly. Finish with lemon.

Dinner.title: Bhindi Stir Fry (Okra) Low Oil
steps: Pat dry okra to reduce slime.
Saute onions in a little oil, add okra and cook on medium without covering until tender.
Season with spices, salt and a squeeze of lemon.
Dinner.prepNotes: Wash and thoroughly dry okra before slicing.

Dinner.title: Tomato Fish Curry (Light)
ingredients: 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp coriander, chili to taste
steps: Saute onion in oil; add ginger garlic and spices; cook briefly.
Add tomato puree and simmer until thick.
Slide in fish pieces and poach gently until cooked. Garnish.
Dinner.prepNotes: Thaw fish in refrigerator overnight if frozen.
